qas.question: What are events that a company can sponsor when it is planning a new construction project or redesigning an existing one?
What is provided to guide entrants in an architectural competition?
What kinds of people generally make up the panels which judge architecture competitions?
What is necessary for the integrity of a design competition?
What kind of artistic production can be supported by design competitions?
What are events that a company can't sponsor when it is planning a new construction project or redesigning an existing one?
What is not provided to guide entrants in an architectural competition?
What kinds of people never make up the panels which judge architecture competitions?
What is unnecessary for the integrity of a design competition?
What kind of artistic production can no longer be supported by design competitions?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Architectural design competitions<b5_0/><a0_0/> are used by an organisation that plans to build a new building or refurbish an existing building. They can be used for buildings, engineering work, structures, landscape design projects or <a4_0><b9_0>public realm artworks<b9_0/><a4_0/>. A competition typically asks for architects and/or designers to submit a design proposal in response to a given <a1_0><b6_0>Brief<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The winning design will then be selected by an independent jury panel of <a2_0><b7_0>design professionals and client representatives<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The <a3_0><b8_0>independence of the jury<b8_0/><a3_0/> is vital to the fair conduct of a competition.
